result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeron Ross Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeron Ross Davis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeron Ross Davis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeron Ross Davis

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis. Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases21CF9, 22CF29, and 22CF168. State recites agreement. 22CF9 - 2years IC, 2 years ES imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. Conditions of 33 days jail with 33 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs. 22CF29 - plead to disorderly conduct with domestic abuse modifier. 14 days jail with 14 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs. 22CF168 - plead to counts 1, 2, 3, and 6. 2 and 3 - 2 years IC, 2 years ES, imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. Conditions of 69 days jail with 69 days credit, time served. Count 6, 69 days jail, time served. Count 1, 60 days jail, time served.

22CF29, defendant pleads no contest to count 1. 22CF168, defendant pleads no contest to count 1, count 2, count 3, and count 6. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court reviews voting rights. JOC is entered in count 1 of 21CF9 due to agreement of parties and the deferred agreement is revoked. Court accepts pleas and finds that the pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Any other remaining counts are dismissed. 

Court orders in 22CF29 - on count 1, 14 days jail with 14 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs. Bail to cover amount and to cover any balance on other cases. In 21CF9, 2years IC, 2 years ES imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. Conditions of 33 days jail with 33 days credit, time served, $10 fine plus costs, and DOC programming. Bail to cover amount and to cover any balance on other cases. In 22CF168, Count 1 - 60 days jail, with 60 days credit, time served. Count 6, 69 days jail with 69 days credit. Time served. Count 2 and 3, 2 years IC, 2 years ES. Imposed and stayed for 5 years of probation. If revoked, prison time will be consecutive to 21CF9, but count 2 and 3 will be concurrent to each other. Probation is concurrent to each other and other files. Conditions of 69 days jail, 69 days credit. Time served. DOC programming, DAIP programming, $50 fine plus costs. No contact with victim but the no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. Prohibited from possessing firearms. 21CF9 - ineligible for both programs. 22CF168 - eligible for both programs.

11:30 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates close to agreement, asks for plea date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF168, received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Hoffman requests a status conference next week. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:59 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates that the offer has been withdrawn due to the defendant picking up new charges. State asks for reset for 30 to 45 days. Attorney Hoffman does not object. Court reminds attorneys about the importance of getting all of the pending matters resolved.
Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:42 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jeron Ross Davis.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Hoffman would like to set both cases for a possible Plea and Sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:39 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Asks for a status 30-45 days out. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

01:49 PM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video means with Attorney. Court doesn't see anything filed in this case for a bail/bond hearing. State doesn't object and will proceed. Atty Hoffman indicates defendant is sitting on a $1000 cash bond. He does qualify for Public Defender services. Life long resident. Atty is asking for $300 cash bail. State is objecting to the reduction of bail. State gives prior criminal history. State indicates there are failures to appear in Wisconsin and in Minnesota. State indicates that the criminal history dates back as far as 2009. 
Court denies motion at this time. Defendant has been incaracated since 2/1/22. Court acknowledges 5 F.T.A.'s and at least 2 new felony charges. Court would order the $300 if $500 would secure his appearance but it did not. 
Defendant addresses the Court. Defendant would like the bail to be reduced so he can go back to work and not lose his job or his home. Defendant indicates he doesn't have any reason to run. Defendant indicates he doesn't have any family or friends to aid him in his current bail. Court denies reduction in bail. Defendant requests lower than $1000 and indicates he's not trying to evade. 
Court again denies bail reduction.

records.addlTxt: 09:14 AM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Court reminds of bail/conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription, No contact with victim 1 or victim 1's address as listed in the ID Key,

01:31 PM Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Jeron Ross Davis in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeron Ross Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, enter pleas of not guilty on counts 1-3 for misdemeanors. Court accepts pleas of not guilty.  States request on bail: $1500 cash bail with conditions of No contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in the ID Key, No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State gives prior criminal history with several F.T.A.'s previously. 
Atty Hoffman indicates defendant is life long resident. Does have family living in the area. Defendant indicates he works in town. He is scheduled to work today. Defendant has no money to post. Defendant is asking for signature bond.
Court has concerns as this is a felony and there is a deferred judgment and violation allegations in a prior case. Court will not give signature bond. Court Orders $1000 cash bond with conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription, No contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in the ID Key.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
